introduction.p:
Let X,Y,Z be finite sets, perhaps of different sizes. Let f:X \rightarrow Y and g:Y \rightarrow Z.
Decide whether each of the following statements is true or false.
If the statement is true, provide a proof. (It will be easier to prove the contrapositive.)
If the statement is false, provide a counterexample.

statement.p: If g \circ f is injective then f is injective.
If g \circ f is injective then g is injective.
If g \circ f is surjective then f is surjective.
If g \circ f is surjective then g is surjective.
